intro: Astragalus erioceratiformis, commonly known as the woolly milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small leaflets, and it produces cylindrical seed pods that split open when mature. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Astragalus erioceratiformis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
